definition: to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: I hope to see my grandchildren in Australia before I turn up my toes .
sentences.chinese: 我希望在我翘辫子之前去澳大利亚看看我的孙子。

sentences.english: Didn't you hear ? He kicked the bucket. Had a heart attack , I think.
sentences.chinese: 你没听说吧？他翘辫子了。我想是因为心脏病。

sentences.english: They keep one plane on permanent standby in case I should kick the bucket.
sentences.chinese: 他们有一架长期待命的飞机，在我翘辫子的时候用。

sentences.english: You never know when your time is up.
sentences.chinese: 你永远不会知道自己什么时候翘辫子。

sentences.english: Illusions of the, Love gone, What will you?
sentences.chinese: 我的心翘辫子，死走了，你呢？

definition: to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
see 一命嗚呼|一命呜呼[yi1 ming4 wu1 hu1]
to die/euphemism, lit. to return West or to the Western Paradise
to die/lit. to visit Marx/to pass away
to stop breathing/to breathe one's last/to die/to cut the gas supply
to say definitely/to commit (to a proposition)
